channel.title: BUbreakingSectionTwo
channel.description: This is a randomly ordered feed of the most recent entries from BUbreakingSectionTwo, skipping any feeds with errors.

item.title: Treasury Secretary Scott Bessent says the economy may slow as part of a ‘detox’ from government spending
item.description: Bessent said employment should come from private companies, not the federal government.

item.title: The spectacular Synapse collapse: The ugliest divorce in fintech left $200 million in customer money frozen—and shows the risks of financial apps
item.description: Is the failure of this buzzy startup a canary in the coal mine for bigger problems in fintech?

item.title: Fed in No Hurry to Adjust Rates Amid Trump Policy Uncertainty
item.description: Jerome H. Powell says the Fed is focused on separating “signal from the noise,” as the president whipsaws on tariffs.

item.title: Trump hit a law firm with an executive order severely limiting the government from working with it. The same firm represented Hillary Clinton’s campaign
item.description: A spokesperson for the law firm called it “patently unlawful.”

item.title: More Than 140 Killed in Clashes Between Syrian Forces and Assad Loyalists
item.description: Two days of fighting along the Mediterranean coast were among the bloodiest battles since rebels ousted the dictator Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: Inside the Explosive Meeting Where Trump Officials Clashed With Elon Musk
item.description: Simmering anger at the billionaire’s unchecked power spilled out in a remarkable Cabinet Room meeting. The president quickly moved to rein in Mr. Musk...

item.title: What We Know About the Clashes in Syria
item.description: Dozens have been killed in fierce clashes between government forces and gunmen loyal to the Assad regime, in a serious challenge to the country’s new ...

item.title: Daughter of Pelicot Accuses Him of Rape in Police Complaint
item.description: Dominique Pelicot, who was convicted of drugging and raping his wife for years, had denied abusing his daughter in a trial that horrified France.

item.title: Billionaire Barry Silbert’s Digital Currency Group launches crypto mining venture Fortitude
item.description: The new Fortitude venture will “look across the entire proof-of-work ecosystem to say what’s going to give us the largest return.”

item.title: France’s Ex-Intelligence Chief Convicted in Influence Peddling Trial Involving LVMH
item.description: Bernard Squarcini was found guilty of organizing a bizarre illegal surveillance operation on a gadfly journalist at the request of the luxury company,...

item.title: Trump Offers South African Farmers Expedited Citizenship
item.description: The president falsely claimed on social media that the South African government was confiscating farmland, echoing previous statements that the countr...

item.title: More Than 140 Killed in Clashes Between Syrian Forces and Assad Loyalists
item.description: Two days of fighting along the Mediterranean coast were among the bloodiest battles since rebels ousted the dictator Bashar al-Assad.

item.title: CEO of $4.2 billion tech giant says defying Silicon Valley’s ‘move fast and break things’ mantra was essential to growing his business
item.description: The founder of dbt Labs Tristan Handy says moving at his own pace fostered innovation and growth—it can feel antithetical to the strategies of Google ...

item.title: Facing the Looming Threat of A.I., Publishers Turn to Decentralized Platforms
item.description: Facing the looming threat of A.I. as a competitor, some publishers are considering an alternative to the internet’s all-powerful algorithms.
